snippet: Students who can afford to live in the intern capitals — D.C., New York and Los Angeles — often rely on help from their parents and loans for rent....
abstract: Unpaid interns working in Washington, DC, and other expensive cities like New York and Los Angeles, either pay their way with part-time work, or rely on family or loans to bear cost of living expenses; economists worry that free labor could depress wages, as well as turn government into place where only wealthy students can afford to work for free.
lead_paragraph: Students who can afford to live in the intern capitals — D.C., New York and Los Angeles — often rely on help from their parents and loans for rent.

headline.main: Part-Time Jobs and Thrift: How Unpaid Interns in D.C. Get By
headline.print_headline: Part-Time Jobs and Thrift Help Capital’s Interns Pay  for Unpaid Experience
